nodes.bodyText: Could we add an inline comment to describe this if?  I'm not sure I understand why we are checking if the permission check is on an Item, but not a READ and Item is not archived and not withdrawn.  What is the scenario we are validating here?

I'd appreciate it if we could add Comments either to the method or the Feature Class to describe what permissions are required for the Feature to return true.
So, for this one, it looks like in order to Create a Bitstream..You MUST have both WRITE and ADD on the Bundle which the Item is being added to, AND have WRITE and ADD on the Item.

I don't understand this scenario (sidenote, there's a misspelling here: "partent").  Isn't a Bundle always under an Item?
Is this just some sort of safety check to verify we never have an "unattached" Bundle?  If there's a scenario I'm not thinking of, then maybe we should add an inline comment here (or again, describe above the method or class what scenarios/permissions this Feature is checking for)
It is indeed a safety check
Again, would be good to add a comment to describe. In this scenario, it looks like you can Create a Bundle as long as you have WRITE and ADD on the Item.

Again, adding comments on how this returns true would be useful. In this case, since the method is bigger (and it manages several object types), you could just add them inline.
(I'll stop adding this same comment now... it applies to all these new Feature classes though)

You don't need to save the old value of the configuration and reset it.  The entire ConfigurationService should auto-reload between tests, thus resetting all configs back to the defaults.  So, you can remove this destroy and the global originalAlwaysThrowException variable
I don't think you need these lines. Since you created removePermission from ResourcePolicyBuilder, it should be cleaned up automatically.

I'm personally OK with this change in behavior, as it's more consistent with the meaning of "Administrator" privileges (e.g. an Item Admin can delete that Item, and a Collection Admin can delete that Collection).
However, I do agree that it needs documentation (for example in the 7.0 Release Notes), as it is a change from DSpace 6.x.  I can add a note there once this PR is merged.
